items.title: Temu partners with Atome for flexible payments in Malaysia
items.summary:
- Temu has partnered with Atome to provide flexible payment options in Malaysia, allowing interest-free installment plans at checkout.
- New Atome users get discount vouchers for their first Temu purchase.
- The partnership supports Malaysia's growing ecommerce trend, where nearly half of Malaysians shopped online last year, particularly younger consumers.
- The ICT and ecommerce sectors contributed 427.7 billion ringgit (US$96.96 billion) to Malaysia's economy in 2023, marking a 3.9% increase from 2022.
- This initiative aims to enhance shopping convenience for Temu users.

items.title: Indian apparel startup Geniemode bags $50m for global growth
items.summary:
- Geniemode has raised over US$50 million in Series C funding led by Multiples Alternate Asset Management.
- Funding supported by Fundamentum, Paramark Ventures, and InfoEdge Ventures.
- The company aims to enhance tech-driven supply chain solutions and expand into new global markets.
- Founded in 2021, Geniemode connects small and medium manufacturers with buyers, working with over 200 suppliers across India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.
- This funding round follows previous rounds of US$7 million in January 2022, US$27.5 million in April 2022, and US$2.25 million seed funding in 2021.

items.title: Ant Group’s 2C2P names ex-Grab Thai exec as new CEO
items.summary:
- Worachat Luxkanalode appointed as new CEO of 2C2P, effective April 2025, pending regulatory approval.
- He will focus on expanding operations and serving small and medium-sized enterprises in Southeast Asia.
- Worachat replaces Aung Kyaw Moe, the founder, who will step back from daily operations after the transition.

items.title: Zoom lowers 2026 outlook to $4.79b due to competition
items.summary:
- Zoom Communications revised revenue forecast for FY ending January 2026 to $4.79 billion.
- Expected earnings per share between $5.34 to $5.37, missing analyst predictions.
- Zoom shares dropped in extended trading after closing at $81.10, despite a 28% increase over the past year.
- The company is expanding its offerings beyond videoconferencing with new products.

items.title: Perplexity to launch AI browser Comet
items.summary:
- Perplexity, an AI-powered search engine, plans to develop a new web browser named Comet.
- A sign-up list for Comet has been opened, though details about its release date and design remain undisclosed.
- This venture aims to compete in a crowded browser market, including major players like Google Chrome and various AI-enhanced options.
- Perplexity intends to utilize its existing search engine user base to establish Comet's presence.

items.title: Zomato invests additional $172k in Blinkit
items.summary:
- Zomato invested 1,500 crore rupees (US$172.7) in Blinkit through a rights issue, acquiring 7,612 equity shares at 19,70,171 rupees (US$22.7) per share.
- This follows a previous investment of 500 crore rupees (US$57.5 million), totaling Zomato’s investment in Blinkit to 4,300 crore rupees (US$495).
- Blinkit reported an adjusted EBITDA loss of 103 crore rupees (US$12 million) in Q3, with losses increasing due to upfront investments.
- Blinkit added 216 new dark stores in Q3, surpassing 1,000 total stores and targeting 2,000 by December 2025.

items.title: Exit corporate, enter startup: a femhealth founder’s how-to guide
items.summary:
- The author left a successful corporate job at Heineken to launch a startup focused on women's health.
- Personal health struggles motivated the decision, including migraines, anxiety, and irregular periods.
- The article discusses the lack of representation in medical research for women's health issues, highlighting the need for better understanding and solutions.
- Women often face stigmatization and discrimination in healthcare settings, contributing to their silent suffering.

items.title: Blockchain intelligence firms link N Korea to Bybit heist
items.summary:
- North Korea's Lazarus Group is identified as the likely perpetrator of the $1.4 billion Ethereum heist from Bybit on February 23, 2025.
- Blockchain firms Elliptic and TRM Labs confirmed the connection based on laundering patterns similar to previous North Korean attacks.
- The heist is the largest recorded crypto theft, adding to North Korea's history of cybercrimes, reportedly stealing over $650 million in 2024.
- Bybit is conducting an investigation; however, it has not commented on the North Korea link.
- As of February 24, 2025, Bybit announced that 80% of the stolen Ethereum has been recovered and client funds are secure.

items.title: Google Drive users can now search video transcripts
items.summary:
- Google Drive introduces a feature to search video transcripts directly on the platform.
- Announced on Feb. 24, the feature displays transcripts in a sidebar next to the video player.
- Users can highlight and search for keywords within the transcript in real-time as the video plays.
- Videos must have captions enabled to use this feature, which can be added through Google Drive's settings.

items.title: Chinese AI content platform secures 4 funding rounds
items.summary:
- LiblibAI, a Chinese AI content creation platform, announced on Feb. 24, completing four funding rounds within a year.
- The company raised hundreds of millions of yuan, led by INCE Capital and Shunwei Capital, with participation from Future Capital and Giant Network Group.
- Founded in May 2023, LiblibAI has over 20 million users and has generated more than 500 million images.
- Funds will enhance creator ecosystem, improve technology, and refine user experience, with plans to expand into AI content sharing, copyright management, and sales.
- Challenges include optimizing user experience, data security, and expanding application scenarios.

items.title: Strategy buys 20,356 bitcoins for $2b
items.summary:
- Strategy acquired 20,356 bitcoins for approximately US$2 billion between Feb. 18 and Feb. 23.
- The purchase was disclosed in an 8-K filing with the SEC on Feb. 24.
- With this acquisition, total bitcoin holdings reached 499,096 bitcoins, valued over US$47 billion.
- Average purchase price was US$66,357 per bitcoin, totaling about US$33.1 billion.
- This acquisition represents over 2.3% of bitcoin's capped supply of 21 million coins.

items.title: US SEC ends Robinhood crypto probe with no enforcement action
items.summary:
- The SEC concluded its investigation into Robinhood’s crypto trading without enforcement action on Feb. 24.
- Robinhood disputed the SEC’s classification of digital assets as federal securities.
- The company reported a 400% year-over-year increase in crypto trading volume, totaling $70 billion.

items.title: UAE fintech firm Omnispay raises $1.5m to boost SME payment
items.author: Simanta Das, Vimal Kumar, Praveen Kiran
items.summary:
- Omnispay raised US$1.5 million in seed funding.
- The funding was led by Mercatus Capital Pte. Ltd. with contributions from regional and international investors.
- Founded in 2022, Omnispay provides a platform for SMEs to manage cash flow, including payment collection and borrowing options.
- The platform serves over 1,600 businesses.

items.title: 20 fresh tech and startup jobs in Asia this week
items.author: TIA Jobs Bot
items.summary:
- A list of the 20 most popular tech jobs in Asia published this week.
- Job opportunities span various companies and locations, including Indonesia, Singapore, and Malaysia.
- Job roles require experience ranging from less than 1 year to over 7 years.

items.title: Israeli Cultured Meat Firm Faces Financial Crisis, Cuts Jobs
items.summary:
- Aleph Farms, known for lab-grown beef, is experiencing a financial crisis and seeks $25 million in funding but expects to secure only $10 million.
- The company's valuation has plummeted from $300 million in 2021 to between $80 million and $100 million now.
- The company has laid off staff, reducing its workforce from 140 to 100 by mid-2024 due to financial strain.
- A broader downturn in food tech is evident as Israel's food tech investments fell to $134 million in 2024 from $970 million in 2021.
- Global funding for cultured meat decreased by 78% from 2022 to 2023, attributed to high production costs and commercialization challenges.
- Despite receiving approval from Israel's Ministry of Health in early 2024, Aleph Farms faced high cash burn and scaling issues after rapid expansion in 2021.
- The company is now focusing on streamlining production and cutting costs to demonstrate product demand.

items.title: UK VC firm launches $126m fund for tech startups
items.summary:
- Cambridge Innovation Capital (CIC) has launched a £100 million (US$126 million) “Opportunity Fund” for growth-stage deep tech and life sciences companies in Cambridge.
- The fund, supported by Aviva Investors and British Patient Capital, aims to bridge the UK’s late-stage funding gap.
- Up to £20 million (US$25.2 million) will be provided per company, with initial investments in Pragmatic Semiconductor and Riverlane.
- CIC currently has US$757 million invested in over 40 companies focusing on early-stage ventures.
- The fund aligns with UK government initiatives like the “AI Action Plan” and improvements to the “Golden Triangle.”
- CIC has notable exits, including Gyroscope Therapeutics’ US$1.5 billion sale to Novartis and PetMedix’s US$285 million acquisition by Zoetis.
- Cambridge has a strong tech presence with firms like Arm Holdings, Darktrace, and Bicycle Therapeutics.

items.title: UAE tech services firm Alpha Data prices IPO at top range
items.summary:
- Alpha Data's IPO in Abu Dhabi priced at 1.50 dirham (US$0.41) per share, the top of the range.
- Valuation of the company is 1.5 billion dirham (US$408.4 million).
- IPO offers 400 million shares, representing a 40% stake, with trading set to begin in March 2025.
- The firm has seen strong demand since subscriptions opened.
- Alpha Data, founded in 1981, specializes in AI, big data, security, and cloud services in the UAE, Qatar, and Saudi Arabia.
- The company reported a 23% annual revenue growth rate from 2021 to 2024 and employs 1,500 people.
- Plans to distribute 130 million dirhams (US$35.39 million) in dividends for the financial year ending Dec. 31, in two equal tranches.

items.title: MongoDB Acquires AI Startup Voyage AI to Enhance Retrieval Tools
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- MongoDB Inc. has acquired Palo Alto-based startup Voyage AI for US$220 million in a cash-and-stock deal.
- The acquisition aims to support AI-powered applications with advanced retrieval tools integrated with real-time operational data.
- Voyage AI specializes in embedding and re-ranking models to retrieve accurate information from structured and unstructured data.
- MongoDB CEO Dev Ittycheria mentioned the deal will help address AI “hallucination” issues by combining MongoDB’s storage with Voyage AI’s technology.
- Initial focus on legal, finance, and software development sectors, with plans for broader applications.
- Voyage AI's tools will remain available on its platform and through AWS and Azure, with deeper integration into MongoDB expected later this year.
- MongoDB has partnerships with companies like Alphabet, Microsoft, and IBM for AI-driven solutions.

items.title: UK auto intelligence firm Pinewood.AI buys Dubai autotech
items.author: Tarek Kabrit, Andrew Kabrit
items.summary:
- Pinewood.AI acquires Dubai-based autotech company Seez for US$46.2 million in cash and shares.
- Seez, founded in 2016, transitioned from a vehicle-recognition app to AI software for dealerships.
- The company operates in 16 global markets and has US$4.4 million in annual recurring revenue as of December 2024.
- Parent company Lithia Motors Inc. backs the acquisition, aiming to integrate Seez's AI virtual assistant into its dealership network.
- The acquisition follows a prior investment by Pinewood.AI in September 2024 and is set to enhance its presence in North America and AI-driven tools for dealerships.

items.title: AI patent analytics startup Patlytics bags $14m series A
items.author: Paul Lee, Arthur Jen
items.summary:
- Patlytics raised $14 million in a series A funding round led by Next47, totaling $21 million since January 2024.
- Participants included existing investors like Google’s Gradient, 8VC, and others.
- The startup reported a 20-fold increase in annual recurring revenue.
- Patlytics provides an AI-powered patent analytics platform for IP professionals and law firms.
- Their tools are used for patent drafting, infringement detection, and portfolio management.
- The company is expanding into South Korea and Japan, with pilot programs in the UK and Germany.
- The funding will help enhance product offerings and scale operations.

items.title: Salesforce, Google sign $2.5b AI deal to rival Microsoft
items.summary:
- Salesforce signs a $2.5 billion agreement with Google Cloud for the next seven years.
- This deal allows Salesforce customers to utilize its products on Google’s platform.
- The partnership aims to strengthen competition against Microsoft in the corporate generative AI sector.

items.title: Nvidia’s Q4 revenue falls as DeepSeek disrupts AI chip market
items.summary:
- Nvidia will report its fourth-quarter results on Feb. 26, focusing on demand for its expensive AI chips.
- DeepSeek, a new entrant, claims to produce AI models at significantly lower costs, impacting Nvidia's market valuation.
- Nvidia's market value fell by US$593 billion in one day, marking the largest loss for any US company.
- Analysts forecast a 72% increase in Nvidia’s annual revenue to US$38.05 billion for Q4, the slowest growth in seven quarters.
- Recent developments include various strategic moves by Nvidia in response to competition from DeepSeek and market dynamics.

items.title: Meta launches AI assistant in MENA with Arabic support
items.summary:
- Meta has launched its AI-enabled chatbot, Meta AI, in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA).
- The service is accessible in Algeria, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Libya, Morocco, Saudi Arabia, Tunisia, the UAE, and Yemen.
- Meta AI now supports the Arabic language, improving accessibility for users in the region.
- Users can interact with the assistant by tagging @meta in WhatsApp, Instagram, and Messenger.
- The launch includes the 'Imagine Me' tool for stylized selfies and audio dubbing for Instagram Reels.

items.title: Apple unveils $500b US investment over 4 years
items.summary:
- Apple will invest US$500 billion in the US over the next four years.
- Funding will support US suppliers, manufacturing, and content production for Apple TV+.
- A new 250,000-square-foot factory will be built in Houston, Texas, for AI server production.
- The factory, in collaboration with Foxconn, is expected to be operational by 2026.
- Apple will add 20,000 research and development jobs across the US.

items.title: String of scandals renews call for startup watchdog in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Indonesia's startup ecosystem has faced scrutiny due to multiple fraud cases over the past year.
- Notable case: eFishery allegedly inflated its revenue by nearly US$600 million.
- In May 2024, TaniFund had its business license revoked for financial misconduct.
- In October 2024, Investree lost its business license for failing to meet equity requirements, and its former CEO is wanted for alleged financial crime.
- Discussions on the necessity of a regulatory body similar to the OJK have arisen amidst financial scandals impacting investor confidence.
- Some experts argue that additional regulations could hinder innovation for startups.

items.title: Ex-Investree CEO on the run, spotted at car race in Qatar
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Adrian Gunadi, former CEO of Investree, was spotted at the E1 Series Doha GP 2025 race.
- The sighting was reported by Amir Ali Salemizadeh, CEO of JTA International Investment Holding, but the image was later removed.
- Gunadi is wanted for alleged financial crimes and is suspected of fleeing the country to evade prosecution.
- Indonesian authorities have requested a red notice from Interpol and are seeking to revoke his passport.
- Recent developments include Investree losing its business license over financial issues on October 22, 2024.

items.title: Hot or not: What SEA investors are betting on and what they’re ignoring
EFishery investors may recover just below 10% of their investments
items.summary:
- Investors in eFishery may recover only less than 10% of their investments due to misconduct allegations against founders.
- A report from FTI Consulting indicates eFishery is not commercially viable in its current form, recommending a partial wind-down.
- eFishery has approximately US$50 million in cash reserves, quickly depleting without a restructuring plan.
- Once valued at US$1.4 billion, the startup raised US$315 million with prominent investors like SoftBank and Temasek.
- Under optimistic conditions, recovery is estimated at 9.5 cents on the dollar; conservative estimates drop it to 8.3 cents.
- About 76% of its US$68 million in accounts receivable is now deemed bad debt, with operational inefficiencies noted.
- Investigators cited significant gaps in promised technology, including undeployed sensors, as contributors to losses.

items.title: Just Eat shares jump 54% after Prosus’ acquisition bid
items.summary:
• Just Eat to be acquired by Prosus in an all-cash deal worth approximately €4.1 billion (US$4.3 billion).
• The offer values Just Eat shares at €20.3 (US$21.36) each, a 63% increase from the closing price on February 21.
• Shares of Just Eat jumped 54% on February 24, hitting a 52-week high following the acquisition news.

items.title: No founder, no problem?
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's tech ecosystem is questioning the impact of founder departures on companies like Sea Group and Grab.
- At least 15 unicorns in Asia currently operate without founders in leadership roles, focusing on their performance post-founder exit.
- 10 out of 15 firms analyzed saw valuations drop after founders left, attributed to the tech winter between 2022 and 2024.
- Luckin Coffee's market cap increased significantly after founder's termination, while Bukalapak’s valuation dropped compared to its peak.
- Investors believe the benefits of being founder-led depend on the company’s stage and growth needs.

items.title: Tesla recalls over 370k vehicles for steering system issue
items.summary:
- Tesla is recalling 376,241 vehicles in the US over a potential issue with power-assisted steering systems.
- Affected models include Model 3 and Model Y manufactured between Feb. 28, 2023, and Oct. 11, 2023.
- The issue involves overstressed printed circuit boards that may lead to steering failure when stopping and accelerating.
- If power-assisted steering fails, drivers may need more effort to steer, increasing accident risk.
- Tesla is unaware of any related crashes or injuries and is offering an over-the-air software update as a solution.
- This recall follows an investigation and a voluntary recall in China for similar issues.

items.title: Substack launches video features for creators to monetize
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Substack introduces video capabilities for creators.
- This feature aims to help creators monetize their content more effectively.
- It allows users to integrate video into their newsletters and paywalls.
- The launch is part of Substack's broader strategy to enhance creator tools.

items.title: Hyundai develops solid-state EV batteries for 2030
items.summary:
- Hyundai plans to produce its own electric vehicle (EV) batteries, causing concerns among manufacturers.
- Local suppliers like SK On and LG Energy Solution may be impacted.
- Trial production of all-solid-state batteries is expected to start by the end of 2025.
- Commercial availability is anticipated around 2030 to reduce EV production costs against competitors.
- Recent developments include partnerships and projects aimed at enhancing Hyundai's EV capabilities.

items.title: Indian edtech firm Veranda acquires 2 education platforms
items.summary:
- Veranda Learning Solutions has acquired stakes in BB Virtuals (40.41%) and Navkar Digital (65%).
- The acquisitions were announced on February 24, 2025, with plans to increase the stake in BB Virtuals to 51% by June 2025.
- BB Virtuals supports Chartered Accountancy and CMA aspirants, having trained over 200,000 students online.
- Navkar Digital offers courses for CA, CS, and CMA aspirants, emphasizing technology in education.
- Both platforms will be integrated with JK Shah Classes, part of Veranda’s portfolio.

items.title: MobiKwik shares hit record low after stake acquisition
items.summary:
- MobiKwik shares fell 5.6% on Feb. 24, lowest recorded at 293.60 rupee (US$3.39).
- By 11:38 AM, the stock slightly recovered to 307 rupee (US$3.54), a 1.4% decrease from the previous close of 311.20 rupee (US$3.59) on Feb. 21.
- The drop followed the announcement of acquiring an additional 3.39% stake in Blostem Fintech for 1.5 crore rupee (US$172.941) on Feb. 21.
- On Feb. 17, shares had also reached an all-time low of 314 rupee (US$3.62).
- MobiKwik's current market capitalization stands at 2,373.71 crore rupee (US$273.67 million).

items.title: These are the most active investors in Vietnam’s startups
DeepSeek unveils FlashMLA to boost AI performance on Nvidia GPUs
items.summary:
- DeepSeek launched FlashMLA, a decoding kernel optimized for Nvidia’s Hopper GPUs.
- FlashMLA reduces memory consumption by 40-60% and achieves 2.3x faster inference for 175B parameter language models.
- The software is open-source on GitHub, part of DeepSeek's Open Source Week initiative.

items.title: Australia fines Telegram $640k for safety issues
items.summary:
- Australia’s eSafety Commission fines Telegram approximately A$1 million (US$640,000) for delayed safety response.
- Telegram failed to provide timely information on combating child abuse and violent extremist content.
- The Commission requested details from Telegram in March 2024 but received a response only in October, hindering safety measures implementation.

items.title: 2C2P founder Aung Kyaw Moe to step down in April
items.summary:
- Aung Kyaw Moe, founder and CEO of 2C2P, will step down in April 2025 after 22 years in leadership.
- He plans to research the growth gap in Southeast Asia's startup ecosystem and write a memoir.
- Piyachart Ratanaprasartporn, CEO of 2C2P Thailand, will also resign, indicating a major leadership shift.
- Piyachart announced that his successor will be announced soon as he plans to retire.
- In 2022, 2C2P became a subsidiary of Ant International, enhancing growth under Aung's leadership.

items.title: Indian tech firm Zoho CEO slams digital signature pricing
items.summary:
- Sridhar Vembu, CEO of Zoho, criticized DocuSign’s pricing as "bloated" and "overpriced."
- His remarks followed Andrew Wilkinson's surprise at DocuSign's costs and searching for cheaper options.
- Vembu promoted Zoho Sign as a cost-effective solution, contrasting Zoho's efficiency with DocuSign's workforce of 6,705 employees.

items.title: Unicommerce stock hits record low despite profit growth
items.summary:
- Shares of Unicommerce fell over 4% to an all-time low of 112.55 rupees on Feb. 24.
- Broader market uncertainties, including U.S. tariff policy concerns, affected investor confidence.
- The stock experienced a 22% decline over the past 11 trading days despite a 62.1% increase in net profit year-on-year for Q3 FY25.
- The company's net profit rose to 6.29 crore rupees, up from 3.88 crore rupees in the same period last year, also reflecting a sequential profit increase of 40.7%.

items.title: XPeng plans mass production of ‘Land Aircraft Carrier’ by 2026
items.summary:
- XPeng Aeroht has completed winter testing for the “Land Aircraft Carrier” and is entering the acceptance phase.
- The factory is set to be completed by Q3 2025, with mass production and deliveries targeted for 2026.
- The vehicle features six electric motors, an 800V silicon carbide range extender, and over 1,000 km driving range.
- It can charge the aircraft module while moving or stationary, supporting 5-6 flights per charge.
- The modular aircraft includes a two-seater cockpit with a 270-degree panoramic view and a six-rotor, six-axis system.
- Made from foldable carbon fiber, it ensures easy storage and precise docking with the ground vehicle.

items.title: Prosus to acquire food delivery Just Eat for $4.3b
items.summary:
- Prosus has announced its acquisition of food delivery service Just Eat for $4.3 billion.
- The deal reflects a significant move in the food delivery market.
- Prosus aims to expand its portfolio in the food tech sector with this acquisition.

items.title: Rough opening for GCL
items.author: Samreen
items.summary:
- GCL, a Singapore-based gaming company, listed on the Nasdaq on February 14.
- The company's shares fell 70% on the first trading day.
- CEO Sebastian Toke believes that going public in the US is still the right decision for GCL's future success.

items.title: Indonesian investment body must be open to audits: president
items.summary:
- Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto insists that the Daya Angata Nusantara (Danantara) investment body must be open to audits anytime by any party.
- Emphasized the need for careful management and oversight of Danantara to protect national interests.
- Danantara is seen as a crucial step towards economic independence, with state-owned enterprises being strategic assets that require governance and innovation.
- CEO Rosan Roeslani confirmed external monitoring by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK), the attorney general’s office, and the House of Representatives (DPR).
- Danantara's leadership will be legally scrutinized, with accountability measures in place for corruption and abuse of power.

items.title: US urges EU antitrust chief to clarify Big Tech rules
items.summary:
- Jim Jordan, chairman of the US House Judiciary Committee, requested clarification from EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera on rules affecting Big Tech.
- Concerns were raised in a letter signed by Scott Fitzgerald regarding the regulations' impact on US companies.
- The letter, dated Feb. 23, follows a memorandum from President Trump advocating scrutiny of the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA) and Digital Services Act (DSA).
- The DMA targets major firms like Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, and Microsoft, promoting competition and consumer choice.
- Violations of these regulations could lead to fines of up to 10% of a company's global annual revenue.

items.title: Shenzhen introduces $630m policy to boost AI, robotics
items.summary:
- Shenzhen, China, unveils a policy package worth 4.5 billion yuan (US$630 million) to enhance AI and robotics industries.
- The initiative includes financial support and incentives for innovation within the sector.
- Businesses can receive subsidies covering up to 60% of costs, with a maximum of 10 million yuan (US$1.38 million) in computing power vouchers.
- Additional supports include model vouchers, corpus vouchers, and scene-based subsidies to promote development.

items.title: ChatGPT tops 2m weekly users in S Korea after DeepSeek ban
items.summary:
- ChatGPT's weekly user count in South Korea has exceeded 2 million, reaching 2,092,797 in early February 2025.
- The increase follows a decrease in usage of the Chinese AI app DeepSeek, which was suspended over data privacy issues.
- As a result, ChatGPT's daily users jumped to 855,979 on February 18, 2025, up from 760,766 the previous day.

items.title: China approves 110 domestic, 3 foreign games in February
items.summary:
- Chinese regulators approved 110 domestic video games and 3 foreign titles for February.
- Notable titles include Plants vs Zombies 3 and Door Kickers: Action Squad.
- The licensing trend continues after regulatory changes in 2022, with over 100 licenses granted monthly since then, except for April and May 2023.
- In 2024, 1,306 domestic and 110 foreign games received licenses, an increase from 2023.
- In 2022, only 468 domestic and 44 foreign games were approved due to an eight-month pause.
- Restrictions for gamers under 18 remain strict, limiting playtime to one hour on select days.

items.title: Musk’s Starlink competes with China in satellite internet
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s Starlink is facing increased competition in the global satellite internet market.
- Major competitors include China’s state-backed SpaceSail and Amazon’s Project Kuiper, focusing on low-Earth orbit (LEO) satellite constellations.
- SpaceSail aims to expand its services to Brazil and Kazakhstan, negotiating with over 30 countries and plans to launch 648 satellites this year, with a goal of 15,000 by 2030, contributing to China's target of 43,000 LEO satellites.
